channel.title: CyberNetSec - Industrial Control Systems
channel.description: Latest industrial control systems threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: CISA KEV Alert: Actively Exploited ScadaBR Flaw Puts Industrial Control Systems at Risk
item.description:
CISA has added CVE-2021-26828, a high-severity vulnerability in the OpenPLC ScadaBR industrial control system (ICS) software, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog as of December 3, 2025. The flaw, with a CVSS score of 8.7, is an unrestricted file upload vulnerability that allows an a...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: APTs Exploit WinRAR Zero-Day to Target Industrial Sector in Q3 2025
item.description:
Kaspersky's Q3 2025 threat report for industrial organizations highlights extensive exploitation of a WinRAR zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2025-8088. The flaw was used by multiple threat actors, including the RomCom cybercrime group and the Paper Werewolf (GOFFEE) APT, to deploy backdoors like SnipBot...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: US Probes Bitcoin Mining Giant Bitmain for National Security Threats
item.description:
The U.S. Department of Homeland Security is reportedly conducting a probe, codenamed 'Operation Red Sunset,' into Chinese bitcoin mining hardware manufacturer Bitmain. According to reports from November 29, 2025, the investigation centers on fears that Bitmain's mining devices could contain hidden b...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: Amazon Data Center Blueprints Leaked in Breach of Steel Contractor
item.description:
A significant data breach at Cooper Steel Fabricators, a major U.S. structural steel contractor, was reported on November 30, 2025. A threat actor is selling a 330 GB database, claiming it is a 'complete mirror' of the company's FTP server. The asking price is $28,500. The leaked data allegedly cont...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Adds Actively Exploited OpenPLC XSS Flaw to KEV Catalog After Hacktivist Attacks
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in OpenPLC ScadaBR, CVE-2021-26829, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The action, taken on November 28, 2025, follows confirmed reports of active exploitation by ...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Industrial Control Systems, Threat Actor

item.title: Mitsubishi ICS Software Flaw Exposes Credentials in Plaintext
item.description:
On November 27, 2025, Mitsubishi Electric issued a security advisory for CVE-2025-3784, an information disclosure vulnerability in its GX Works2 industrial control system (ICS) software. The flaw, which affects all versions of the software, involves the storage of credential information in plaintext...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Industrial Control Systems, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Warns of Critical Flaws in Industrial Control Systems, Including CVSS 10.0 Bug
item.description:
On November 25, 2025, CISA issued seven new advisories for vulnerabilities in Industrial Control Systems (ICS) from multiple vendors, including Rockwell Automation, Opto 22, and Zenitel. The flaws affect equipment used globally in critical manufacturing and communications sectors. The most severe vu...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

item.title: SANS Report: OT/ICS Cyber Incidents Rising, 40% Cause Downtime
item.description:
A new report from the SANS Institute highlights a dangerous trend in the security of Operational Technology (OT) and Industrial Control Systems (ICS). The '2025 State of ICS/OT Security Report' found that over 21% of organizations experienced a cyber incident in their OT environment in the past year...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Threat Intelligence, Ransomware

item.title: CISA Issues 6 New ICS Advisories for Schneider Electric, Shelly, METZ CONNECT
item.description:
On November 19, 2025, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) released six new Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories, highlighting multiple vulnerabilities in products from Schneider Electric, Shelly, and METZ CONNECT. The alerts affect a range of operational technolog...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

item.title: CISA Releases "Be Air Aware" Guides to Combat Drone Threats
item.description:
As part of Critical Infrastructure Security and Resilience Month, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has released three new guides under its "Be Air Aware™" campaign. These resources are designed to help critical infrastructure owners and operators understand, assess, a...
